title: Metamorphism and Plate Tectonics: Video-Based Advanced Learning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Earth Science Fundamentals (Rock Cycle, Basic Plate Tectonics), and High School-Level Geology Knowledge
context.additional_context: Customized course designed for professionals to understand geoscience principles contextually through work-integrated learning. Provides real-time feedback via QR code-based assessments in digital environments

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish the three main types of metamorphism (contact, hydrothermal, dynamic) and explain the geological conditions of each process.
Learners can create a conceptual map illustrating the relationship between the four types of plate tectonic movements (divergent/convergent/conservative/hotspot) and metamorphism.
Learners achieve an 80% or higher accuracy rate on formative assessments covering 10 core concepts (e.g., isobars, geological map interpretation) provided through the QR code evaluation system.

resources: 3D Metamorphic Rock Structure Visualization Videos (5 Episodes)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
